availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert M. Martin (Muhlenberg County, KY. laborer and soldier (C.S.A.))

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Hugh M. Martin and Elizabeth Roark Martin. Resident in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Laborer in Ohio County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and colonel from August 1862 to May 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, pp. 225A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Cromwell, p. 712.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0057.
Adam Rankin Johnson and William J. Davis, The Partisan Rangers of the Confederate States Army (Louisville, KY: G.G. Fetter Company, 1904).
Find A Grave, “Col Robert Maxwell Martin (1840-1901),” Memorial #36440212, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/36440212 (accessed May 16, 2018).
